loCandidates.descriptor: Can describe a person's hobbies and activities using simple language.
Can give simple opinions using basic fixed expressions.
Can describe people's everyday lives using a short series of simple phrases and sentences.

Can facilitate an intercultural exchange by showing a welcoming attitude and interest with simple expressions and non-verbal signals, by inviting others to contribute, and by indicating whether they understand when addressed directly.

Can contribute to an intercultural exchange, using simple words/signs to ask people to explain things and to get clarification of what they say, while exploiting their limited repertoire to express agreement, to invite, to thank, etc.
Can make requests related to immediate needs using basic fixed expressions.
Can understand basic questions about free time activities.
Can understand basic information about free time activities.
Can ask someone about their hobbies and activities using simple language.
Can understand the main information in simple conversations about hobbies and interests.
Can use brief, everyday expressions to describe wants and needs, and request information.
Can make a few basic requests related to immediate personal needs (e.g. 'Can I have a pen, please?').

grammarCandidates.descriptor: Can make negative statements using the present simple.
Can make affirmative statements using the present simple without time reference.
Can use subject pronouns with the correct form of the verb 'be' in the simple present.
Can use the present simple passive.
Can make affirmative statements using common regular past simple forms.
Can ask yes/no questions using the present simple.
Can use negative forms of the simple past.
Can make negative suggestions with 'Let's not ...'
Can use 'because' with verb phrases to refer to causes and reasons.
Can use 'like/hate/love' with the '-ing' forms of verbs.
Can express preference with 'like … better more/than ….'
Can use the present continuous to refer to changing situations.
